parameters: \pop[2]We took Kyron to the plane to pick up the rest of his belongings.
\pop[2]Since we were sticking together now, we wouldn't be using the plane anymore.
\pop[2]Pretty short-lived for an HQ. But our homes were clearly safer.
\pop[2]It's weird how the safest option was the riskiest one just a little while ago.
\pop[2]I never would've thought that we'd be bringing Kyron right into our house.
\pop[2]Taylor's house, either; and not only that, but the Quantum Leap, too.
\pop[2]However, one thing surprises me more than all the others.
\pop[2]Kyron wanted me to come into the plane with him. Alone.
\pop[2]Everyone else was waiting outside, granting his request.
\pop[2]I'm not sure what he wanted, but I'm just standing there, watching.
\pop[2]He's putting some stuff into a bag. Just the basics, like toiletries.
\pop[2]There's a pile of clothes on the floor. He has other outfits...?
\pop[2]As soon as he's done packing up, he turns to face me.
Didn't realize I'd be moving in with Isaac and Taylor.
Whichever house we're at though, I'll just take the couch.
\i[5]"It'll be a lot better than this plane, for sure."
\i[2]"I don't mind sharing my bed with you, actually."
\i[0]"It must suck to leave your dream of a plane behind."
\i[6]"At least you won't be a trespasser anymore."
\i[5]"It'll be a lot better than this plane, for sure."
\pop[3]It was fun at first, but the novelty sure wore off.
Especially when we realized they could spy on us from here.
I still doubt they were, but I'm sure \c[23]Argus\c[0] has eyes everywhere.
\i[2]"I don't mind sharing my bed with you, actually."
You never get what you want by being timid.
That's part of why I'm in the city to begin with.
\i[0]"It must suck to leave your dream of a plane behind."
Maybe I'd have to be in one that's flying.
That virtual screen can only be so immersive.
\i[6]"At least you won't be a trespasser anymore."
I'm not allowed in this entire \c[14]city\c[0].
No matter \c[14]where\c[0] I go, I'll be trespassing.
\pop[2]He shrugs, before quickly changing the topic.
\pop[3]Anyway, I guess you're wondering why I asked you here.
Do you think they can hear us from out there?
\pop[2]I shake my head. They definitely can't.
\pop[3]Good. I just wanted to spend some time alone with you.
I think you're the only level-headed one in the group.
Your friends were mumbling like idiots about how to deal with me.
If you're the one who opened their eyes, then you have my thanks.
\pop[3]It makes me wonder what everyone \c[14]else\c[0] out there is thinking.
Why is barely anyone else helping out?
\pop[3]My colony is out there, starving on \c[14]your\c[0] streets.
If everyone banded together, they could easily overthrow \c[23]Argus\c[0].
I guess everyone is just scared to be the "first" to take action.
\pop[3]But at that point, it might not even matter anymore.
The actions of one person ripple and cascade.
The first doesn't matter if an avalanche follows.
\pop[2]He's right. I guess technically, I was the first. My actions could've led to Isaac's actions.
\pop[2]If \c[10]Cipher\c[0] saw that their blueprint worked, then they might spring into action.
\pop[2]It's a little odd to think that I might be the inciting incidenty in all of this change.
\pop[2]I vocalize that thought, and Kyron scoffs, like he thinks I'm stupid.
\pop[3]Nobody saw you give me that apple, though.
If it happened out in the open, maybe others would've followed suit.
I think that's all it'd take. One grand gesture, to push others forward.
\i[3]"Isn't that what \c[10]Cipher\c[0] plans to do next week?"
\i[3]"Isn't that what \c[10]Cipher\c[0] plans to do next week?"
\pop[3]If it's not too late by then, yeah.
Even if one \c[10]zero\c[0] dies, that's too much.
And they're getting close. Have you taken a look?
When we first arrived, they were filled with wonder.
Now they look so weak, and famished. It kills me.
\pop[3]They must be getting food from somewhere, though.
It's been a couple of weeks since we came to the city.
Everyone who helps must be helping in secret.
And the adults clearly prioritize the children.
That just means the caregivers might be the first to die.
\i[3]"I don't think it'll come to that."
\i[3]"I don't think it'll come to that."
An ultimatum, but such a vague deadline?
Maybe that's why \c[23]Argus\c[0] is taking their time.
\pop[2]A specific deadline might make things more urgent.
\pop[2]But \c[23]Argus\c[0] \c[14]must\c[0] be planning something behind the scenes.
They could wait for \c[10]Cipher\c[0] to act, then take \c[14]everyone\c[0] down.
\i[3]"\c[10]Cipher\c[0] isn't the first organization to try. But they might succeed."
\i[3]"\c[10]Cipher\c[0] isn't the first organization to try. But they might succeed."
\pop[3]You mean people have tried this before?
\pop[2]I tell him what Klace told me, but ask him not to repeat it.
\pop[2]Previous rebel groups seemed to disappear without a trace.
\pop[3]Then you think \c[10]Cipher\c[0] would be gone by now...
That's... That's a good sign. Thanks for telling me, Delta.
\pop[2]It's true. Based on the past, \c[10]Cipher\c[0] would be gone by now.
\pop[2]But they still seem to be active, and doing more than any other group in the past.
\pop[2]the fact that Isaac used their technology is proof enough of all that.
\pop[3]Then let's just hope that this stalemate ends soon.
I can't stand just... not knowing what's gonna happen.
Things are so hectic compared to life back home.
\pop[2]If things go well, this might end up \c[14]being\c[0] home for him.
I knew you'd talk some sense into me, Delta.
You're the best one of the bunch. I know it.
\pop[2]He holds out his hand, offering to shake mine.
\pop[2]I shake his, but all of a sudden, he pulls me forward.
\pop[2]My body is close to his, and we're almost face to face.
\pop[3]But I know you feel the same way~
Let's see what happens on New Year's Eve...
\pop[2]I can feel his hot breath land on me as he speaks.
\pop[2]Then he lets go, and I stumble back a couple steps.
\pop[2]I shake it with a firm grip, and he smiles at me.
\pop[2]It's clear that he's a lot less worried than he was before.
\pop[2]I nod, and he grabs his packed up bag.
\pop[2]We begin to walk toward the exit, but he stops in his tracks.
\pop[2]He turns around to face me, like he's nervous.
\pop[3]I wanted to apologize for pointing fingers.
Everything going on just made me a little paranoid.
\pop[2]Him and me both. I tell him that it's fine.
\pop[3]Well, it's not like I was paranoid over nothing...
I heard something, and I"m just not sure if I should repeat it.
\pop[3]Well, it's Klace. I heard him on the phone.
He was saying stuff about how "it's all going well".
\i[3]"He was probably just talking about his hiatus."
\i[3]"He was probably just talking about his hiatus."
But then he said "no, they don't know".
Like he's keeping some sort of secret.
\pop[2]But I'm sure there's some context we're lacking.
\pop[3]Maybe. It sure didn't help my anxiety.
But I guess that's it. We're good to go.
\pop[2]We start to leave the plane, but that thought lingers in my mind.
\pop[2]Normally, I wouldn't worry, but it seems really odd...
\pop[2]Especially combined with how he's always staring at us, taking notes.
\pop[2]He says it's just his diary, but part of me is starting to question things.
\pop[2]I shrug, realizing it's not good to doubt my friends.
\pop[2]But this time, when I shrug, the paranoia remains...
